<center>
  <h3>
Ports CITResewn to NeoForge!
  </h3>
</center>
<br/>
<br/>

##

<center>
   Please report any issues!
  <br/>
  <br/>
  <a href="https://discord.gg/3Q699k7qHr">
    <img src="
https://img.shields.io/badge/discord-5865f2?style=for-the-badge&labelColor=ffffff&logo=data:image/png;base64,
"/>
  </a>
  <a href="https://github.com/HiWord9/CITResewnNeoPatcher/issues">
    <img src="
https://img.shields.io/badge/issue%20tracker-000000?style=for-the-badge&labelColor=ffffff&logo=data:image/png;base64,
"/>
  </a>
</center>
<br/>

CITResewnNeoPatcher is intended to maintain [CIT Resewn](https://modrinth.com/mod/cit-resewn)'s compatibility with [Sinytra Connector](https://modrinth.com/mod/connector), so it runs on NeoForge. It's needed cause there are indivisual compatibility issues preventing CIT Resewn from working with Connector.

Mod requires [CIT Resewn](https://modrinth.com/mod/cit-resewn), [Sinytra Connector](https://modrinth.com/mod/connector) and [Forgified Fabric Api](https://modrinth.com/mod/forgified-fabric-api) to be installed.

It was also created as a way to port [RP Renames](https://modrinth.com/mod/rp-renames) to NeoForge, it works with Connector, but as no CIT system was availabe on NeoForge, it had no sense.

Currently available versions:

|MC|CITResewn|NeoPatcher|
|---|---|---|
|1.21.1|[1.2.0-1.2.2](https://modrinth.com/mod/cit-resewn/version/1.2.2+1.21)|1.0.0|
